intro: Acmispon argophyllus, commonly known as the silverleaf senna, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches heights of about 30 centimeters. The plant features silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its small yellow flowers bloom in spring, and the plant produces seed pods that split open to release its seeds. Acmispon argophyllus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open habitats.
